security_audit.summary: This skill is purely a documentation/guide file with no executable code. It provides conversion guidelines for AI assistants to transform Figma design variables into standard Tailwind CSS classes. No network access, file system manipulation, or code execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Convert Figma Variables to Tailwind CSS
content.value_statement: Figma MCP generates code with proprietary variables like `var(--spacing-4)` that create maintenance issues. This skill provides clear conversion rules to transform these variables into standard Tailwind CSS classes for cleaner, more maintainable frontend code.
actual_capabilities: Converts Figma spacing variables to Tailwind classes (e.g., var(--spacing-4) â†’ px-4)
Maps Figma width and height variables to Tailwind sizing classes
Transforms border-radius variables to rounded-* Tailwind classes
Converts typography variables to text-* utility classes
Provides mapping file reference for consistent conversions
limitations: No automated conversion tool - guides manual transformation
Requires existing figma-tailwind-map.ts mapping file in project
Color values kept as CSS variables, not converted to Tailwind classes
Does not modify files - provides guidance only

prompt_templates.title: Basic conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the Figma variables in this code to standard Tailwind CSS classes using the figma-to-tailwind skill. Focus on spacing, sizing, border-radius, and typography conversions.

prompt_templates.title: Verify mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the conversion against frontend/lib/figma-tailwind-map.ts to ensure the Tailwind classes match the original Figma variable values.

prompt_templates.title: Handle unmapped values
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify any Figma variables that cannot be mapped to standard Tailwind classes and suggest appropriate tailwind.config.ts additions.

prompt_templates.title: Complete refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Transform this Figma MCP component: convert all spacing/width/height variables to Tailwind classes, replace inline typography styles with text-* classes, and identify colors that should remain as CSS variables.

best_practices: Always reference the figma-tailwind-map.ts file before converting to ensure accurate value mapping
Verify Figma variable values against actual Tailwind classes - do not rely on name similarity alone
Run lint and build checks after conversion to ensure no regressions
anti_patterns: Using Figma variables directly in className like px-[var(--spacing-4)] instead of converting to px-4
Creating custom utility classes in globals.css to wrap Figma variables instead of using standard Tailwind
Converting typography using inline styles instead of applying text-* utility classes

faq.question: Which Figma MCP versions are supported?
faq.answer: Supports all current Figma MCP versions including get_design_context and get_variable_defs calls.

faq.question: Do I need to create custom Tailwind classes?
faq.answer: Only for values not covered by standard Tailwind. Add them to tailwind.config.ts following the skill's guidance.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides conversion guidance and recommendations for manual application.

faq.question: What about colors and typography?
faq.answer: Colors stay as CSS variables. Typography converts to text-* utility classes defined in your project.

faq.question: How do I handle unmapped Figma variables?
faq.answer: Add missing mappings to frontend/lib/figma-tailwind-map.ts and extend tailwind.config.ts as needed.

faq.question: Does this work with shadcn/ui?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill references shadcn/ui variables and helps map Figma colors to existing CSS custom properties.
